required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Rectus Musle Reapproximation During Cesarean Section
clinical_study.official_title: Intraoperative and Postoperative Results of Rectus Musle Reapproximation During Cesarean Section

lead_sponsor.agency: Kanuni Sultan Suleyman Training and Research Hospital

clinical_study.source: Kanuni Sultan Suleyman Training and Research Hospital

brief_summary.textblock: During Cesarean section in Group 1 rectus muscle will be closed with interrupted sutures. In group 2 rectus muscle will not be closed. Postoperative pain scores, distance between the rectus muscles and bowel functions will be evaluated.

detailed_description.textblock: Pfannenstiel incision will be done under general or spinal anesthesia. The abdomen will be opened and fetus and placenta will be delivered. Then the abdomen will be closed. In Group 1 rectus muscle will be closed with interrupted sutures. In group 2 rectus muscle will not be closed. Postoperative pain scores, distance between the rectus muscles and bowel functions will be evaluated.

primary_outcome.description: Visual Analog Scores, minimum score is 0, maximum score is 10. Score 10 represents highest pain score.
Distance between the margins of the rectus muscles in centimeters will be measured with ultrasonography

arm_group.description: During Cesarean Section rectus muscle will be reapproximated with interrupted sutures.
During Cesarean Section rectus muscle will not be closed.

intervention.description: Pfnannenstiel incision will be done under general or spinal anaesthesia. The abdomen will be opened and fetus and plasenta will be delivered. Then abdomen will be closed.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 18-40 years old women undergoing cesarean section
Exclusion Criteria:
- grandmultiparas

reference.citation: Lyell DJ, Naqvi M, Wong A, Urban R, Carvalho B. Rectus Muscle Reapproximation at Cesarean Delivery and Postoperative Pain: A Randomized Controlled Trial. Surg J (N Y). 2017 Aug 11;3(3):e128-e133. doi: 10.1055/s-0037-1604074. eCollection 2017 Jul.

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Kanuni Sultan Suleyman Training and Research Hospital
